TopicTitle: Make the solar panels wobble under speed in atmosphere

Articles.Content:
Example, A panel is moving at 1500 m/s at 30 km, the panels would be wobbling. It gets more powerful until it breaks.

I think its hard to integrate it to current solar panels.

Solar panels already break at much lower speeds than that. I don't think wobbling is necessary. Maybe if they were a bit tougher wobbling could represent a warning that you need to slow down.

Anyway travelling at 1500m/s would mean your panels break off as soon as they are deployed.

Maybe if they were a bit tougher wobbling could represent a warning that you need to slow down.

Thats good idea.
I was returning from Minmus at 3 km/s and, burning retrograde, the solar panels lasted a while, a good thirty seconds or so, in the atmosphere.
